messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Articles about unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: I put those up here: http://unschooling.blogspot.com so those who like to look back at articles don t need to save those links. The first one has this quote:
messages.messageBody:
I put those up here:
http://unschooling.blogspot.com

so those who like to look back at articles don't need to save those
links.

The first one has this quote:

-=-Benny’s parents aren’t home-schooling in the traditional sense, by
hewing to a curriculum, nor are they strictly “unschooling,” that is,
following the teachings of John Holt, a progressive educator who
promoted a child-led learning movement that is a wildly democratic
subset of the home-schooling world. -=-

Since I don't think of it as "democratic," I don't like the idea that
it's a "wildly democratic subset," but it's just one tossed-off
definition of dozens in the world.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] how to create podcasts/mp3s
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thanks for the pointer -- and, yeah, you don t want to know. -pam
messages.messageBody:
On 3/9/2009 2:22 AM, emiLy Q. wrote:
> Why on earth did you go from Mac to PC? Or maybe I don't want to know.:)
>
>
Thanks for the pointer -- and, yeah, you don't want to know.

-pam

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] how to create podcasts/mp3s
messages.msgSnippet: I have a Mac too but I think Audacity is what PC people use.  I use Audacity to record because my podcasting co-host has a PC so she uses it too, then she
messages.messageBody:
I have a Mac too but I think Audacity is what PC people use. I use Audacity
to record because my podcasting co-host has a PC so she uses it too, then
she sends me her AIFF file and I mix everything in GarageBand. But you can
use Audacity to mix too.
http://audacity.sourceforge.net/

Why on earth did you go from Mac to PC? Or maybe I don't want to know. :)

-emiLy

messages.subject: how to create podcasts/mp3s
messages.msgSnippet: Reposting because I forgot to change the subject - sorry about that!
messages.messageBody:
Reposting because I forgot to change the subject - sorry about that!



On 3/9/2009 2:02 AM, Pam Sorooshian wrote:
> Does anybody here create simple podcasts using a pc? I used to have a
> mac and I used garageband to make podcasts and it was super simple. All
> I want is one track of music and one track for a voice. I want to be
> able to create mp3's from it.
>
> Any advice would be appreciated - maybe offlist, though, since it isn't
> directly about unschooling.
>
> Thanks!
>
> -pam
> pamsoroosh @ earthlink.net
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Articles about unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Does anybody here create simple podcasts using a pc? I used to have a mac and I used garageband to make podcasts and it was super simple. All I want is one
messages.messageBody:
Does anybody here create simple podcasts using a pc? I used to have a
mac and I used garageband to make podcasts and it was super simple. All
I want is one track of music and one track for a voice. I want to be
able to create mp3's from it.

Any advice would be appreciated - maybe offlist, though, since it isn't
directly about unschooling.

Thanks!

-pam
pamsoroosh @ earthlink.net
